docs.snippet: Barcelona trimmed Real Madrid's lead at the top of La Liga to one point when in-form forward Luis Suarez played a part in all three of their goals in a scrappy 3-1 victory at Granada on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona trimmed Real Madrid's lead at the top of La Liga to one point when in-form forward Luis Suarez played a part in all three of their goals in a scrappy 3-1 victory at Granada on Saturday.

headline.main: Barca on Real's Heels After Suarez's Granada Show

docs.snippet: Barcelona's decision to buy Luis Suarez from Liverpool following his ban for biting an opponent at the 2014 World Cup raised a few eyebrows but it increasingly appears their faith in the Uruguay forward was justified.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona's decision to buy Luis Suarez from Liverpool following his ban for biting an opponent at the 2014 World Cup raised a few eyebrows but it increasingly appears their faith in the Uruguay forward was justified.

docs.snippet: Venezuela will shrink the size of the U.S. Embassy staff, limit the activities of U.S. diplomats and require American citizens to apply for visas if they want to come bask on the beach.

docs.snippet: One leftist leader replaced another in Uruguay on Sunday, a change seemingly marked more by style than differences in policy as the elegant Tabare Vazquez took over from the famously casual Jose Mujica, who formally left office in rubber-soled brown...
docs.lead_paragraph: One leftist leader replaced another in Uruguay on Sunday, a change seemingly marked more by style than differences in policy as the elegant Tabare Vazquez took over from the famously casual Jose Mujica, who formally left office in rubber-soled brown shoes.

headline.main: Elegant Vazquez Replaces Folksy Mujica as Uruguay President
headline.print_headline: Elegant Vazquez Replaces Folksy Mujica as Uruguay President

docs.snippet: The new Uruguayan government will keep to the path set out by the outgoing administration to curb above-target inflation and a ballooning fiscal deficit, President Tabare Vazquez said in his first message to the country after being sworn in on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The new Uruguayan government will keep to the path set out by the outgoing administration to curb above-target inflation and a ballooning fiscal deficit, President Tabare Vazquez said in his first message to the country after being sworn in on Sunday.

headline.main: New Uruguayan Leader Says He'll Stick to Economic Targets
headline.print_headline: New Uruguayan Leader Says He'll Stick to Economic Targets

docs.snippet: Five months after 43 students from a rural teachers college in Mexico's Guerrero state disappeared, marches by relatives and protesters continued, some turning violent with confrontations like what was seen Tuesday at a metro station in Mexico's...
docs.lead_paragraph: Five months after 43 students from a rural teachers college in Mexico's Guerrero state disappeared, marches by relatives and protesters continued, some turning violent with confrontations like what was seen Tuesday at a metro station in Mexico's capital. In Michoacan state, federal police captured Servando "La Tuta" Gomez, one of Mexico's most-wanted drug lords.

headline.print_headline: AP PHOTOS: Editor Selections From Latin America

docs.snippet: A Minnesota religious leader sought by the U.S. on sex charges was able to elude a manhunt because of the support of a local woman, a longtime friend who travelled with him and supported him, the Brazilian lead investigator in the case said...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Minnesota religious leader sought by the U.S. on sex charges was able to elude a manhunt because of the support of a local woman, a longtime friend who travelled with him and supported him, the Brazilian lead investigator in the case said Wednesday.

headline.main: Brazil Police Say Woman Helped US Sect Leader Avoid Arrest
headline.print_headline: Brazil Police Say Woman Helped US Sect Leader Avoid Arrest

docs.snippet: AZAPIAN--Asadur (Arturo) Elmassian, age 84, of New York City, passed away peacefully at home on March 5th, 2015 of natural causes. He was born in Montevideo, Uruguay. He was a graduate of the Escuela de Bellas Artes of Montevideo and came to NYC to...
docs.lead_paragraph:
AZAPIAN--Asadur (Arturo)

Elmassian, age 84, of New York City, passed away peacefully at home on March 5th, 2015 of natural causes. He was born in Montevideo, Uruguay. He was a graduate of the Escuela de Bellas Artes of Montevideo and came to NYC to continue his art studies. A painter, he also was a restaurateur, and owned the Peacock Caffe, the Greenwich Village landmark, until its closing in 1998. He is survived by his wife, Shelley, his daughter Jennifer, his brother Hagop Azapian, his sister Nuri Azapian de Ferrari and his nieces and nephews. He was a lover of classical music and his own work reflected his great knowledge and love of Renaissance art. His family and friends will remember his creativity and his playful sense of humor. Funeral services to be held at "The Riverside" 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave. on Sunday, March 8th at 11:45am. Charitable Donations in his honor may be made to: The Armenian General Benevolent Fund and the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research.
